description: The high speed railway HS2, if approved, will link London, Birmingham, Leeds and Manchester and create space on the rail network that will help improve services

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["HS2 is a high-speed railway which will link London and Birmingham by 2026. We are working closely with HS2 Ltd to make sure that the transport system can support the new infrastructure."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}

We have secured agreements with the company to protect passengers, assets and services. But building HS2 - currently the largest infrastructure project in Europe - is likely to disrupt some journeys during construction.

Under the plans, HS2 services into and out of London will use an improved Euston station. A new station will also be built in the Old Oak Common area to allow interchange with services of the Elizabeth line (currently being built by Crossrail Ltd) and helping to regenerate the area.
HS2 Ltd is also proposing links to Leeds and Manchester by 2033.
See more on the HS2 Ltd website .
